title: (x) "Small Town DJs" constructed geometric face w/ soft edges - custom designed {Lex}
content:
Anyone know the name for this font please? thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114075814im_/http:/typophile.com/files/1130756583_l_4968.jpg)
author: hellomatt

comments.content: Do you _really_ think that adding that annoying _Help pleaaassee!!!_ will make us help you any faster? :^/

If this is a font, it has been customized (check out the length of the lower bar on both 'S's. My guess is that this was just created using a grid and rounded strokes in Illustrator.

- Lex
That's how I would do it as well -- I couldn't find anything yet. Also the fact that the characters fit together like a puzzle point in the direction of a custom designed piece.
What's that last word? Small Town what?

It looks really familiar thats what i thought it may have been a font.  
Looking at it now i can see how this could be made in Illustrator, so i may just have a go.

On another note.......  
Does anyone have any of these Letraset fonts that i am after.....

•PLUTO OUTLINE  
•BLOCK SCHWER  
•CABLE HEAVY  
•BABY TEETH  
•PLAYBOY ULTRA

Thnakyou.  
-Matt

To my knowledge _Baby Teeth_ and _Pluto Outline_ never were digitized. _Block_ can be found [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114075814/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/block-be/). _Cable Heavy_ is a rip-off of Kabel, I don't know if it is the [ATF](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114075814/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/linotype/kabel_std_ot_virtual/) or the [ITC](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114075814/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/itc/itc_kabel/) version you need. And I've never heard of _Playboy Ultra_, although Googling it produces some... errr... interesting hits. :^P

This is the same as the new Nike air max 180 logo. I'm guessing it's been modified from there. Can remember who designed it though.

Graeme

i knew id seen theat font/style before.

Hmmmm..... i wonder if it is actually a font then.....?
This is indeed most likely created customly. If you set up a grid of guidelines in Illustrator, this sort of lettering is very easy to create.

After seeing the Nike ad, I'm not so sure it's custom anymore.

- Lex

Definately custom. The company which designed the Nike work also designed a logo for the thai restaurant busaba in the uk. I remember seeing it on their website, but i can't find it anymore. :(

Graeme
